etymology.description: 石(stone) + 库(Wu topolect: doorframe/jamb) + 门(door/gate) = stone-framed gate, the emblematic entry of this housing style.
etymology.interpretation: Names the lilong residential style distinguished by a heavy stone-framed doorway. By extension it denotes the broader traditional Shanghainese streetscape built around such gates.
etymology.simplification: Standard script reform simplified 庫→库 and 門→门 to reduce strokes; meaning and formation unchanged.

examples.chinese: 上海的石库门建筑保存了近代城市记忆(上海的石庫門建築保存了近代城市記憶)。
examples.pinyin: Shànghǎi de Shíkùmén jiànzhù bǎocún le jìndài chéngshì jìyì.
examples.english: Shikumen architecture in Shanghai preserves the memory of the modern city.

examples.chinese: 游客漫步在弄堂里(遊客漫步在弄堂裡)，欣赏石库门的雕花门楣(欣賞石庫門的雕花門楣)。
examples.pinyin: Yóukè mànbù zài lòngtáng lǐ, xīnshǎng Shíkùmén de diāohuā ménméi.
examples.english: Tourists stroll through the lanes, admiring the carved lintels of Shikumen gates.

examples.chinese: 这种风格融合中西元素(這種風格融合中西元素)，成为上海的象征(成為上海的象徵)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng fēnggé rónghé zhōng xī yuánsù, chéngwéi Shànghǎi de xiàngzhēng.
examples.english: This style blends Chinese and Western elements and has become a symbol of Shanghai.
